docs.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on how DNA undoes secrecy.
docs.snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on how DNA undoes secrecy.
docs.lead_paragraph: I’m 45, living in the United States. My brother is two years older and lives in Australia. Neither of us gets on with our 86-year-old mother, who lives in London. Our father, whom we were both really close to, died in 1985 after a long illness. I was 13, my brother 15, and it affected us very badly with little help from our mother.

headline.main: Can I Tell My Brother the Truth About Our Paternity?
headline.print_headline: Can I Tell My Brother the Truth About Our Paternity?

docs.snippet: On the joy of being almost done.

docs.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on preserving racially prejudiced — or otherwise bigoted — historical artifacts.
docs.snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on preserving racially prejudiced — or otherwise bigoted — historical artifacts.
docs.lead_paragraph: While renovating our home 30 years ago, we found an album of old postcards lodged in a rafter. Many were from the turn of the century, addressed to members of a family that settled in our community. A brief search at the time did not turn up any descendants.

headline.main: What Should I Do With Old Racist Memorabilia?
headline.print_headline: What Should I Do With Old Racist Memorabilia?

docs.abstract: Which takes priority, recreating a geometric pattern from Pinterest or repainting the kitchen?
docs.snippet: Which takes priority, recreating a geometric pattern from Pinterest or repainting the kitchen?
docs.lead_paragraph: Toni writes: My sister wants my help painting an elaborate mural in her garage: a geometric pattern that is popular on Pinterest. I think this is unnecessary. I, however, could use help repainting my kitchen. Basically I think she has too much time on her hands and I don’t make a lot of money. She should help me.

headline.main: Judge John Hodgman on a Garage Mural
headline.print_headline: Bonus Advice From Judge John Hodgman

docs.abstract: Is it right to water plants on the apartment balcony in your underwear?
docs.snippet: Is it right to water plants on the apartment balcony in your underwear?
docs.lead_paragraph: My boyfriend and I live in a New York apartment with a balcony. Dan likes to go out and water our plants in his boxers. I say our neighbors do not want to see him in his underpants. Please stop the madness!

headline.main: Judge John Hodgman on the Gardening Exhibitionist

docs.abstract: Include a specific memory. Avoid platitudes and religious language.
docs.snippet: Include a specific memory. Avoid platitudes and religious language.
docs.lead_paragraph: “It doesn’t have to be in flowery language on fancy stationery,” says Barbara Bouton, who worked with bereaved families for more than two decades at a hospice in Louisville, Ky., before joining the National Hospice and Palliative Care Organization. People often avoid those who have experienced death — they literally look away. Don’t do that. Your loved ones will die, too. Death is part of the connective tissue that binds humans across time and culture and place. Sit down and write the person a letter; doing so will make it easier when you see that person to look her in the eye and acknowledge the loss.

headline.main: How to Write a Condolence Letter
headline.print_headline: How to Write a Condolence Letter
